thread.title: Medicare 2015: Where to get help evaluating or switching plans
thread.title_full: Medicare 2015: Where to get help evaluating or switching plans | OregonLive.com

author: Brent Hunsberger | For The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Medicare 2015: Where to get help evaluating or switching plans
text:
Medicare open enrollment runs Oct. 15 to Dec. 7. Here are resources to help you evaluate plans.
You can use this chart to compare the largest Portland-area Medicare managed care plans with drug coverage.
Online
• Visit Medicare.gov. Its Plan Finder allows you to compare a wide range of costs across multiple drug and Medicare Advantage plans available in your county. It also has ratings on each plan's performance and quality. Most important, it allows you to enter your prescription drugs to find out whether they're covered and at what cost across a variety of plans.
• Check Medicare Rights Center's Medicare Interactive site to find answers about Medicare benefits.
• Read It's Only Money's past columns on picking a Medicare plan.
By phone
• Volunteers from the Senior Health Insurance Benefits Assistance program can answer questions by phone. In Oregon, call 800-722-4134. In Washington state, call 800-562-6900.
• Call Medicare Rights Center counselors at 800-333-4114.
• Call Medicare itself at 1-800-MEDICARE (800-633-4227).
In person
Volunteers with SHIBA also offer free counseling. To find workshops in your Oregon area, visit bit.ly/OregonSHIBA . In Washington, visit bit.ly/WashingtonSHIBA .
•
Washington and Columbia county residents can call 503-846-3094 to schedule an appointment or sign up to attend the following workshops:
• Mondays, Oct. 19 through Dec. 7 (except Nov. 9), 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. at Elsie Stuhr Center, 5550 S.W. Hall Blvd., Beaverton, 503-629-6342.
• Tuesdays, Oct. 20 through Dec. 1, 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. at North Plains Senior Center, 31450 N.W. Commercial St., 503-647-5666. Walk-ins OK.
• Wednesdays, Oct. 14 through Dec. 2 (except Nov. 11), 11:30 a.m. to 2 p.m., Hillsboro Community Senior Center, 750 S.E. Eighth Ave., 503-648-3823. Walk-ins OK.
• Wednesdays, Oct. 14 to Dec. 2, 11:30 a.m. to 1 p.m., Tigard Senior Center, 8815 S.W. O'Mara St., 503-620-4613.
• Thursdays, Oct. 15 to Dec. 3, 9 a.m. to 3 p.m., Washington County Disability, Aging & Veteran Services, 5240 N.E. Elam Young Parkway #300, Hillsboro, 503-846-3094.
• Thursdays, Oct. 15 to Dec. 3, 11 a.m. to 2 p.m., Marjorie Stewart Senior Center, 21790 S.W. Sherwood Blvd., Sherwood, 503-625-5644.
• Fridays, Oct. 16 to Dec. 4, 11 a.m. to 2 p.m, Juanita Pohl Center, 8513 S.W. Tualatin Road, Tualatin, 503-691-3061.
•
Clackamas County residents can call 503-655-8269 to schedule an appointment anytime during the year. They can also attend one of the following presentations and individual counseling workshops:
Group presentations
• Oct. 8, 10 to 11:30 a.m., Canby Adult Center, 1250 S. Ivy St., 503-266-2970.
• Oct. 12, 2 to 3:30 p.m. Oregon City Pioneer Community Center, 615 Fifth St.,
503-657-8287.
• Oct. 13, 10 to 11 a.m., and 6:30 to 7:30 p.m., Lake Oswego Adult Community Center, 505 G Ave., 503-635-3758.
• Oct. 14, 10:30 a.m. to noon, Milwaukie Center, 5440 S.E. Kellogg Creek Drive,
503-653-8100.
• Oct. 15, 1 to 2:30 p.m., West Linn Adult Community Center, 1180 Rosemont Road, 503-557-4704.
• Oct. 19, 12:30 to 2 p.m., Sandy Senior Center, 38348 Pioneer Blvd., 503-668-5569.
• Oct. 20, 10:30 to 11:30 a.m., Hoodland Senior Center, 65000 E. Hwy. 26, Welches, 503-622-3331 (Individual counseling provided until 1:30 p.m.).
• Oct. 21, 11 a.m. to noon, Estacada Community Center, 200 S.W. Clubhouse Drive, 503-630-7454 (Individual counseling: noon to 2 p.m.).
• Oct. 22, 1 to 2 p.m., Wilsonville Community Center, 7965 S.W. Wilsonville Road, 503-682-3727 (Individual counseling: 2 to 3:30 p.m.).
• Oct. 27, 10:30 to 11:30 a.m., Gladstone Senior Center, 1050 Portland Ave., 503-655-7701 (Individual counseling: 11:30 to 2 p.m.).
• Nov. 5, 11 a.m. to noon, Molalla Adult Community Center, 315 Kennel St., 503-829-4214 (Individual counseling: noon to 2 p.m.).
Individual counseling sessions
• Oct. 28, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m., Milwaukie Center.
• Nov. 4, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m., Canby Adult Center.
• Nov. 10, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Oregon City Pioneer Community Center.
• Nov. 12, 10:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m., Willamette Christian Church, 3153 Brandywine Dr.
• Nov. 16, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m., Sandy Senior Center.
• Nov. 17, 10:30 a.m. to 2:30, Lake Oswego Adult Community Center.
•
Multnomah County residents can call 503-988-3646 during normal business hours to make an hourlong appointment with a trained, impartial volunteer. The following enrollment events are in Portland, unless otherwise noted:
• Oct. 19, Midland Library, 805 S.E. 122nd Ave.
• Oct. 23, Hillsdale Library, 1525 S.W. Sunset Blvd.
• Oct. 30, Hollywood Library, 4040 N.E. Tillamook St.
• Nov. 6, Midland Library
• Nov. 9, St. Johns Library, 7510 N. Charleston Ave.
• Nov. 13, Hollywood Library
• Nov. 20, Hillsdale Library
• Nov. 24, Midland Library
• Dec. 4, Midland Library
Multnomah County SHIBA also will host hourlong workshops explaining the basics of Medicare, offering tips for choosing a plan and demonstrating how to use Medicare Plan Finder's website. No appointments necessary. These "Making Medicare Easier" presentations take place:
• Oct. 24, 10:30 a.m., Friendly House, 1737 N.W. 26th Ave.
• Nov. 7, 11:30 a.m., Gresham Library, 385 N.W. Miller Ave., Gresham
• Nov. 21, 10:30 a.m., Hollywood Library
Residents also can call to schedule appointments for individual counseling and enrollment sessions at regularly scheduled monthly sites in Portland and Gresham (please ask for a "SHIBA appointment" when calling):
• Every second and fourth Thursday, Friendly House Senior Center, 1737 N.W. 26th Ave., 503-224-2640.
• Every first and third Wednesday, Hollywood Senior Center, 1820 N.E. 40th Ave.,
503-288-8303.
• Every second and fourth Friday, Charles Jordan Community Center, 9009 N. Foss Ave., 503-288-8303.
• Every Wednesday, Multicultural Senior Center (Urban League), 5325 N.E. MLK Jr. Blvd., 503-280-2600 ext. 632.
• Every first and third Thursday, Neighborhood House, 7688 S.W. Capitol Hwy., 503-244-5204.
• Every Wednesday and Friday, Multnomah County Lincoln Building, 421 S.W. Oak, first floor, 503-988-3646.
• Every Monday, S.E. Multicultural Senior Center, 4610 S.E. Belmont St., 503-988-7175.
• Every Wednesday and Thursday, IRCO Cherry Blossom Senior Program Office, 740 S.E. 106th Ave., 503-988-6073.
• Every Wednesday and Thursday, East County YWCA, 600 N.E. 8th St, Gresham. 503-988-8898.
